revised_title: On Detecting the Motion of the Solar System through the Luminiferous Ether
tldr: The author discusses a possible method to detect the motion of the solar system through the luminiferous ether using the apparent retardation of eclipses of Jupiter's satellites. The proposed method relies on the geocentric position of Jupiter and the velocity of light, offering a unique approach to estimate the direction and magnitude of the sun's velocity relative to the ether.
